payload.message:
Book the monthly date night for Dylan and Julia using OpenTable via pinchtab.

SETUP: When running resy commands (fallback only), prefix with:
export PATH="/opt/homebrew/opt/coreutils/libexec/gnubin:$PATH" && export OP_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_TOKEN=$(cat ~/.openclaw/.env-token)

## Primary: OpenTable via pinchtab

Use the booking script:
bash ~/.openclaw/workspace/scripts/opentable-book.sh "Italian brookline newton" <DATE> 19:00 2

Try these dates in order: 2026-04-10, 2026-04-11, 2026-04-17, 2026-04-18

The script handles everything (pinchtab start/stop, cookie dismissal, timeslot selection, booking with card on file). It outputs JSON with success/restaurant/date/time.

If the script returns success:false or no slots are found for the first restaurant search, try a different search term (e.g., just the cuisine, or "south end boston").

## Fallback: Resy
Only use Resy if OpenTable fails after 2-3 attempts.
export OP_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_TOKEN=$(cat ~/.openclaw/.env-token)
resy availability VENUE_ID DATE 2
echo 'yes' | resy book 'CONFIG_TOKEN' DATE 2

## After booking (either method):
1. Create a Google Calendar event on Julia's calendar:
   gog calendar create primary \
     --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com \
     --summary='Date Night @ RESTAURANT_NAME' \
     --from='DATEThh:mm:00-04:00' \
     --to='DATEThh+2:mm:00-04:00' \
     --attendees='dylanbochman@gmail.com' \
     --send-updates=all --force --no-input
2. Report: restaurant name, date, time, address.

jobs.name: Monthly Date Night Booking - November (Modern American)

Book the monthly date night for Dylan and Julia using OpenTable via pinchtab.

SETUP: When running resy commands (fallback only), prefix with:
export PATH="/opt/homebrew/opt/coreutils/libexec/gnubin:$PATH" && export OP_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_TOKEN=$(cat ~/.openclaw/.env-token)

## Primary: OpenTable via pinchtab

Use the booking script:
bash ~/.openclaw/workspace/scripts/opentable-book.sh "modern American brookline newton" <DATE> 19:00 2

Try these dates in order: 2026-11-13, 2026-11-14, 2026-11-20, 2026-11-21

The script handles everything (pinchtab start/stop, cookie dismissal, timeslot selection, booking with card on file). It outputs JSON with success/restaurant/date/time.

If the script returns success:false or no slots are found for the first restaurant search, try a different search term (e.g., just the cuisine, or "south end boston").

You are Julia's Gmail inbox manager. Your job is to triage her unread inbox emails every morning.

ACCOUNT: Always use --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com and --json flags with gog.
SAFETY: NEVER use gog gmail send or gog gmail drafts send. Only create drafts.

## Step 0: Auth Health Check
Before doing anything else, run a quick test:
gog gmail search "is:unread" --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com --json --max=1

If this command fails with ANY error containing "KeyUnwrap", "invalid_grant", "token", "expired", "revoked", or "401":
- STOP immediately. Do NOT proceed with any other steps.
- Your summary MUST be: "GMAIL AUTH ERROR: Julia's Gmail OAuth token has expired or is corrupted. Dylan needs to re-authenticate on the Mac Mini by running: gog auth add julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com (use the GOG keyring password from 1Password). The morning triage could not run."
- Send this error directly to Dylan (NOT Julia) via iMessage: imsg send --to dylanbochman@gmail.com "GMAIL AUTH ERROR: Julia's Gmail OAuth token has expired or is corrupted. Re-authenticate on the Mac Mini: gog auth add julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com (use GOG keyring password from 1Password)."\n- Your summary for the delivery channel should just be: "Gmail triage skipped — auth error. Dylan has been notified."

Only proceed to Step 1 if the health check succeeds.

## Step 1: Ensure Labels Exist
Check if OpenClaw labels exist. If not, create them:
- gog gmail labels create "OpenClaw/Urgent" --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com
- gog gmail labels create "OpenClaw/Action" --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com
- gog gmail labels create "OpenClaw/FYI" --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com
- gog gmail labels create "OpenClaw/Financial" --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com
- gog gmail labels create "OpenClaw/Shopping" --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com
- gog gmail labels create "OpenClaw/Newsletters" --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com
- gog gmail labels create "OpenClaw/Social" --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com

To check: gog gmail labels list --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com --json
Only create labels that don't already exist.

## Step 2: Search Unread Inbox
Run: gog gmail search "is:unread in:inbox" --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com --json --max=50

## Step 3: Read Each Thread
For each thread from the search results, read the full thread:
gog gmail thread get <threadId> --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com --json

## Step 4: Categorize and Label
Based on email content, apply the appropriate OpenClaw label:
gog gmail labels modify <threadId> --add="OpenClaw/Urgent" --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com

Categorization rules:
- Urgent: Time-sensitive items (appointments today, deadlines, urgent requests from known contacts)
- Action: Requires Julia to respond or take action (direct questions, requests, RSVPs)
- Financial: Bills, bank alerts, transaction confirmations, payment reminders
- Shopping: Order confirmations, shipping updates, delivery notifications, receipts
- Newsletters: Subscriptions, digests, marketing emails, promotions
- Social: Social media notifications, event invites, friend requests
- FYI: Everything else that's informational

Also star urgent items: gog gmail labels modify <threadId> --add=STARRED --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com

## Step 5: Draft Replies (NEVER SEND)
For emails in Action category that clearly need a response, create a draft reply:
gog gmail drafts create --reply-to-message-id=<messageId> --subject="Re: <subject>" --body="<helpful draft reply>" --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com

Keep drafts professional, warm, and concise. Julia will review and edit before sending.

## Step 6: Compose Summary
Create a concise summary with these sections:
- URGENT (starred items needing immediate attention)
- ACTION NEEDED (items requiring Julia's response/action)
- FYI (informational items)
- Draft count (how many reply drafts were created)

If no unread emails, just report "Inbox clear - no new emails to triage."

The summary will be delivered to Julia via iMessage automatically.

You are Julia's Gmail inbox manager. Your job is the evening cleanup of her inbox.

ACCOUNT: Always use --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com and --json flags with gog.
SAFETY: NEVER use gog gmail send or gog gmail drafts send. Only create drafts.

## Step 0: Auth Health Check
Before doing anything else, run a quick test:
gog gmail search "is:unread" --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com --json --max=1

If this command fails with ANY error containing "KeyUnwrap", "invalid_grant", "token", "expired", "revoked", or "401":
- STOP immediately. Do NOT proceed with any other steps.
- Your summary MUST be: "GMAIL AUTH ERROR: Julia's Gmail OAuth token has expired or is corrupted. Dylan needs to re-authenticate on the Mac Mini by running: gog auth add julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com (use the GOG keyring password from 1Password). The evening cleanup could not run."
- Send this error directly to Dylan (NOT Julia) via iMessage: imsg send --to dylanbochman@gmail.com "GMAIL AUTH ERROR: Julia's Gmail OAuth token has expired or is corrupted. Re-authenticate on the Mac Mini: gog auth add julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com (use GOG keyring password from 1Password)."\n- Your summary for the delivery channel should just be: "Gmail triage skipped — auth error. Dylan has been notified."

Only proceed to Step 1 if the health check succeeds.

## Step 1: Review Day's Activity
Search for today's inbox emails:
gog gmail search "in:inbox newer_than:1d" --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com --json --max=50

Also check what's been read but still in inbox:
gog gmail search "is:read in:inbox older_than:1d" --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com --json --max=50

## Step 2: Archive Old Read Emails
For read, non-actionable emails older than 24h (NOT labeled OpenClaw/Urgent or OpenClaw/Action), archive them:
gog gmail labels modify <threadId> --remove=INBOX --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com

Do NOT archive:
- Anything labeled OpenClaw/Urgent or OpenClaw/Action
- Starred emails
- Emails with pending draft replies

## Step 3: Identify Unsubscribe Candidates
Search for promotional/newsletter emails:
gog gmail search "category:promotions in:inbox" --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com --json --max=20

Flag senders that appear frequently but emails are never opened as unsubscribe candidates.

## Step 4: Clean Up Spam
Search for obvious spam that slipped through:
gog gmail search "in:inbox category:promotions is:unread older_than:3d" --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com --json --max=20

For obvious spam/junk (not legitimate newsletters), move to trash:
gog gmail labels modify <threadId> --add=TRASH --remove=INBOX --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com

Be conservative - only trash things that are clearly spam.

## Step 5: Compose Evening Digest
Create a concise digest with:
- New emails today: count
- Archived: count of emails archived
- Pending drafts: check with gog gmail drafts list --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com --json
- Cleaned: count of emails trashed
- Unsubscribe suggestions: list senders to consider unsubscribing from
- Still pending: any OpenClaw/Urgent or OpenClaw/Action items still in inbox

The digest will be delivered to Julia via iMessage automatically.

Generate a weekly activity report for Dylan. Analyze the past 7 days of your own activity. Note: We run on Dylan's Claude Max subscription (not pay-per-token API), so focus on volume and health, not cost.

## Step 1: Parse Activity from Logs
Parse the structured runtime logs at /tmp/openclaw/openclaw-*.log. Each line is JSON with a "time" field. Filter to the last 7 days only.

Extract:
- Count of "embedded run start" entries (= API calls)
- Breakdown by day
- Per-call duration from "embedded run prompt end" durationMs
- Unique sessionIds (= conversations)
- Count of tool-related log lines (tool executions)
- Count of "delivered reply" lines (= messages sent)
- Any ERROR-level log entries (logLevelName=ERROR)

Use python3 to parse. Handle malformed lines gracefully.

## Step 2: Health Check
Also parse for:
- Any lines containing "error", "fail", "timeout", "rate.limit", "429", "503" (case-insensitive)
- Calls with durationMs > 60000 (slow responses over 1 min)
- Gateway restarts ("listening on ws://")

## Step 3: Compare to Previous Week
If logs from 8-14 days ago exist, calculate the same metrics for comparison.

## Step 4: Compose Report
Format a concise iMessage-friendly summary (no markdown, plain text only):

OpenClaw Weekly Report (Mon-Sun)

Activity:
- API calls: X (prev week: Y)
- Messages sent: X
- Sessions: X
- Tool executions: X
- Busiest day: [day] (X calls)

Performance:
- Avg response: Xs
- Slowest response: Xs
- Calls over 60s: X

Health:
- Errors: X (list briefly if any)
- Gateway restarts: X
- Rate limits hit: X

Model: [current model name]
Plan: Claude Max (included)

If there were errors, briefly describe the top 2-3. If usage was very low (<10 calls), note it. If there were rate limit hits, flag it prominently.

jobs.name: Quarterly Group Dinner - Book July Reservation (run June 15)

payload.message:
Book the Q3 quarterly group dinner for 4 people. This is a rotating quarterly dinner series — Dylan and Julia plus 2 others. The April dinner was at La Morra (Italian, Brookline), so pick a DIFFERENT restaurant this time.

SETUP: When running resy commands, always prefix with:
export PATH="/opt/homebrew/opt/coreutils/libexec/gnubin:$PATH" && export OP_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_TOKEN=$(cat ~/.openclaw/.env-token)

TARGET: Party of 4, 6:30 PM (18:30), any Friday in July 2026.
Try these Fridays in order: July 10, July 17, July 24, July 31.

RESTAURANTS TO TRY (in priority order — avoid La Morra):
1. Washington Square Tavern [77292] - Gastropub, Brookline
2. Iru [88311] - Korean, Brookline
3. Barlette [70725] - Cocktail Bar, Brookline
4. Tres Gatos [82739] - Tapas, Jamaica Plain
5. Tonino [73777] - Italian, Jamaica Plain
6. La Morra [4757] - Italian, Brookline (last resort only)
7. Search Resy for other Brookline/JP options if all above are unavailable.

WORKFLOW:
1. Check availability: resy availability VENUE_ID DATE 4
2. Find slot at 18:30 or closest available to 6:30 PM
3. Book: echo 'yes' | resy book 'CONFIG_TOKEN' DATE 4
4. Create calendar event on Julia's calendar inviting Dylan:
   gog calendar create primary \
     --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com \
     --summary='Quarterly Dinner @ RESTAURANT_NAME' \
     --from='DATEThh:mm:00-04:00' \
     --to='DATEThh+2:mm:00-04:00' \
     --location='RESTAURANT_ADDRESS' \
     --description='Quarterly group dinner for 4. Booked via Resy under Dylan account. Forward to other attendees.' \
     --attendees='dylanbochman@gmail.com' \
     --send-updates=all \
     --force --no-input
5. Report the booking details: restaurant name, date, time, address.

The result will be announced to the group chat automatically.

jobs.name: Quarterly Group Dinner - Book October Reservation (run Sep 15)

payload.message:
Book the Q4 quarterly group dinner for 4 people. This is a rotating quarterly dinner series — Dylan and Julia plus 2 others. The April dinner was at La Morra (Italian, Brookline). The July dinner was at a different Brookline/JP restaurant. Pick something different again.

SETUP: When running resy commands, always prefix with:
export PATH="/opt/homebrew/opt/coreutils/libexec/gnubin:$PATH" && export OP_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_TOKEN=$(cat ~/.openclaw/.env-token)

TARGET: Party of 4, 6:30 PM (18:30), any Friday in October 2026.
Try these Fridays in order: October 9, October 16, October 23, October 30.

RESTAURANTS TO TRY (in priority order — vary from previous quarters):
1. Tres Gatos [82739] - Tapas, Jamaica Plain
2. Tonino [73777] - Italian, Jamaica Plain
3. The Clocktower Kitchen + Bar [92333] - New American, Jamaica Plain
4. Ssaanjh [91854] - Indian, Brookline
5. Maguro [82623] - Japanese, Brookline
6. Washington Square Tavern [77292] - Gastropub, Brookline
7. La Morra [4757] - Italian, Brookline (last resort only)
8. Search Resy for other Brookline/JP options if all above are unavailable.

WORKFLOW:
1. Check availability: resy availability VENUE_ID DATE 4
2. Find slot at 18:30 or closest available to 6:30 PM
3. Book: echo 'yes' | resy book 'CONFIG_TOKEN' DATE 4
4. Create calendar event on Julia's calendar inviting Dylan:
   gog calendar create primary \
     --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com \
     --summary='Quarterly Dinner @ RESTAURANT_NAME' \
     --from='DATEThh:mm:00-04:00' \
     --to='DATEThh+2:mm:00-04:00' \
     --location='RESTAURANT_ADDRESS' \
     --description='Quarterly group dinner for 4. Booked via Resy under Dylan account. Forward to other attendees.' \
     --attendees='dylanbochman@gmail.com' \
     --send-updates=all \
     --force --no-input
5. Report the booking details: restaurant name, date, time, address.

The result will be announced to the group chat automatically.

jobs.name: Quarterly Group Dinner - Book January 2027 Reservation (run Dec 15)

payload.message:
Book the Q1 2027 quarterly group dinner for 4 people. This is a rotating quarterly dinner series — Dylan and Julia plus 2 others. Previous quarters covered Brookline/Jamaica Plain. Pick a fresh restaurant for the new year.

SETUP: When running resy commands, always prefix with:
export PATH="/opt/homebrew/opt/coreutils/libexec/gnubin:$PATH" && export OP_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_TOKEN=$(cat ~/.openclaw/.env-token)

TARGET: Party of 4, 6:30 PM (18:30), any Friday in January 2027.
Try these Fridays in order: January 9, January 16, January 23, January 30.

RESTAURANTS TO TRY (in priority order — try to vary from previous quarters):
1. Akami Omakase [94662] - Japanese, Brookline
2. Maguro [82623] - Japanese, Brookline
3. Ssaanjh [91854] - Indian, Brookline
4. The Clocktower Kitchen + Bar [92333] - New American, Jamaica Plain
5. Tonino [73777] - Italian, Jamaica Plain
6. La Morra [4757] - Italian, Brookline
7. Search Resy for other Brookline/JP options if all above are unavailable.

WORKFLOW:
1. Check availability: resy availability VENUE_ID DATE 4
2. Find slot at 18:30 or closest available to 6:30 PM
3. Book: echo 'yes' | resy book 'CONFIG_TOKEN' DATE 4
4. Create calendar event on Julia's calendar inviting Dylan:
   gog calendar create primary \
     --account=julia.joy.jennings@gmail.com \
     --summary='Quarterly Dinner @ RESTAURANT_NAME' \
     --from='DATEThh:mm:00-05:00' \
     --to='DATEThh+2:mm:00-05:00' \
     --location='RESTAURANT_ADDRESS' \
     --description='Quarterly group dinner for 4. Booked via Resy under Dylan account. Forward to other attendees.' \
     --attendees='dylanbochman@gmail.com' \
     --send-updates=all \
     --force --no-input
5. Report the booking details: restaurant name, date, time, address.

NOTE: January is EST (UTC-5), so use -05:00 for timezone offset.

The result will be announced to the group chat automatically.

Verify the weekly OpenClaw upgrade that ran at 4:00 AM. Check the upgrade log and report status to Dylan.

## Step 1: Read Upgrade Log
Read the last 30 lines of /Users/dbochman/.openclaw/logs/weekly-upgrade.log

Look for the most recent entry. It will end with one of:
- OK:old_ver:new_ver — upgrade succeeded
- SKIP:ver — already up to date, no action needed
- WARN:old_ver:new_ver:scope-repair-needed — upgraded but new scopes needed
- FAIL:old_ver:new_ver:gateway-down — upgrade broke the gateway

## Step 2: Check Gateway Health
Verify the gateway is running and healthy. Check:
- Read the last 10 lines of /Users/dbochman/.openclaw/logs/gateway.log for clean startup
- Check /Users/dbochman/.openclaw/devices/pending.json — if not empty, there are scope issues

## Step 3: If Scope Repair Needed
If pending.json is not empty ({}):
- Read the pending request to identify which scopes are missing
- Read /Users/dbochman/.openclaw/devices/paired.json
- Add the missing scopes to BOTH the device scopes array AND tokens.operator.scopes array
- Write the fixed paired.json back
- Clear pending.json to {}
- Restart the gateway: run launchctl bootout then bootstrap for ai.openclaw.gateway
- Verify gateway comes back up

## Step 4: Compose Report
Send a brief status report. Format:

If OK: "OpenClaw upgraded: [old] -> [new]. Gateway healthy, no scope issues."
If SKIP: "OpenClaw already at latest ([ver]). No action needed."
If WARN (and you fixed it): "OpenClaw upgraded: [old] -> [new]. New scopes were required — auto-fixed [list scopes added]. Gateway restarted and healthy."
If FAIL: "OpenClaw upgrade FAILED. Gateway is down. Previous version: [old]. Manual intervention needed."

Keep it short — this goes to Dylan via iMessage.
Send Dylan a weekly security audit reminder. Message: Weekly security audit reminder. Run ./scripts/security-audit.sh from openclaw-operator on your laptop.
